2. Parse an XML file and read into memory

You should use this function to read the content of an XML file into memory. The argument of the function is the name of the file to be read. The function will return a handle to the structure created during the parsing of the file content. 

 DOC = xml::ParseFile("my_file.xml")

[Contents]

3. Create a new empty document

 DOC = xml::NewDoc("1.0")

[Contents]

4. Release a document from memory

When an XML document is not needed by the BASIC program any more the program should free the memory used up by the document calling the function FreeDoc. 

xml::FreeDoc DOC

14. get the property of a node

15. Create a new name space defintion

Use this function to create a new name space definition. 

  ns = xml::NewNs(node, href,prefix)

[Contents]

16. Release a name space definition

Use this function to release a name space definition created by the function xml::NewNs, which is not needed anymore. 

  xml::FreeNs ns

[Contents]

17. Create a new child under a node

Use this function to create a new child under an already existing node. 

  newNode = xml::NewChild(parent,nameSpace,name,content)

Arguments:

  • parent is the parent node. The function will appens a new child node after the last child node of the parent node.
  • nameSpace is optional handler to the name space. May be undef.
  • name is the name of the new node, should be a string.
  • content optional string content.

[Contents]

18. Create a new text child under a node

Use this function to create a new text child under an already existing node. 

  newNode = xml::NewTextChild(parent,nameSpace,name,content)

Arguments:

  • parent is the parent node. The function will appens a new child node after the last child node of the parent node.
  • nameSpace is optional handler to the name space. May be undef.
  • name is the name of the new node, should be a string.
  • content optional string content.

[Contents]

19. Create a new document node

Use this function to create a new document node. 

  newNode = xml::NewDocNode(parent,nameSpace,name,content)

Arguments:

  • parent is the parent node. The function will appens a new child node after the last child node of the parent node.
  • nameSpace is optional handler to the name space. May be undef.
  • name is the name of the new node, should be a string.
  • content optional string content.
